revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-08 18:16:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix BaremetalScenario base to use Credentials

Managers and base classes were refactored to use Credentials
but the Baremetal scenario base was not updated, causing breakage
in the Ironic gate.  This ensures BaremetalScenarioTest base class
properly instantiates its baremetal_client using the correct Credentials
object.

Change-Id: I5577edcd8da14275eb336ee8137eade2084756c9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-08 19:58:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix issues introduced /w migration to Credentials

Managers and base classes were refactored to use Credentials
but this change missed a couple of things that slipped through
the gate:

* The Baremetal scenario base was not updated, causing breakage
  in the Ironic gate.  This ensures BaremetalScenarioTest base class
  properly instantiates its baremetal_client using the correct Credentials
  object.

* A reference before assignment bug now exists in BaseV3ComputeAdminTest
  when running without tenant isolation.  This fixes it.

Change-Id: I5577edcd8da14275eb336ee8137eade2084756c9
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-05-09 17:11:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix issues introduced /w migration to Credentials

Managers and base classes were refactored to use Credentials
but this change missed an issue that slipped through the gate:

* The Baremetal scenario base was not updated, causing breakage
  in the Ironic gate.  This ensures BaremetalScenarioTest base class
  properly instantiates its baremetal_client using the correct Credentials
  object.

Change-Id: I5577edcd8da14275eb336ee8137eade2084756c9
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fix issues introduced /w migration to Credentials

Managers and base classes were refactored to use Credentials
but this change missed an issue that slipped through the gate:

* The Baremetal scenario base was not updated, causing breakage
  in the Ironic gate.  This ensures BaremetalScenarioTest base class
  properly instantiates its baremetal_client using the correct Credentials
  object.

Change-Id: I5577edcd8da14275eb336ee8137eade2084756c9

commit_message:
Add support to dynamically upload drivers in PLUMgrid plugin

PLUMgrid plugin will be able to dynamycally upload any of its available drivers.
It will simplify any CI testing by changing the configuration file for the plugin
instead of changing the code directly.

Change-Id: I56da881688cfdf8f9a1b655c1080c39ffc0133a5
Closes-bug: #1315137

commit_message:
Ensure core plugin deallocation after every test

The unit tests were previously consuming an excessive amount of memory
(4GB+) due to plugin instances persisting in memory.  Deallocation was
not possible where a combination of circular references and mocking
was involved.  This patch ensures that only NeutronManager holds a
plugin reference and that all other references are instances of
weakref.proxy.  Residual memory footprint for tox executed on a
12-core machine has been reduced to ~1.3GB.  Plugin deallocation is
validated at the end of each test to prevent regressions.

This change also includes fixes to unit tests that depended on plugin
instances persisting across tests.

Partial-Bug: #1234857
Change-Id: Ia1f868c2d206eb72ef77d290d054f3c48ab58c94

subject: Add pypcap to global-requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-06 18:45:01.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add pypcap to global-requirements

Ironic-python-agent needs a way to obtain LLDP info. As far as I can
tell, the two ways to do this are:
* capture an LLDP packet and parse it
* run lldpd and lldpctl to obtain the info

The latter is a poor choice for IPA, as lldpd requires:
* installing perl
* running a daemon

IPA is baked into a ramdisk and is intended to run as a single
process. So the perl dependency bloats the image, and running a
daemon is undesirable.

Our plan is to capture and parse LLDP packets in python, and as
far as I can tell pypcap is the best tool for the job.

Change-Id: I297a0505b93925d85fb551d895bdb7d79e26970c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add pypcap to global-requirements

Ironic-python-agent needs a way to obtain LLDP info. As far as I can
tell, the two ways to do this are:
* capture an LLDP packet and parse it
* run lldpd and lldpctl to obtain the info

The latter is a poor choice for IPA, as lldpd requires:
* installing perl
* running a daemon

IPA is baked into a ramdisk and is intended to run as a single
process. So the perl dependency bloats the image, and running a
daemon is undesirable.

Our plan is to capture and parse LLDP packets in python, and as
far as I can tell pypcap is the best tool for the job.

Change-Id: I297a0505b93925d85fb551d895bdb7d79e26970c

commit_message:
rewrite description of logical networks

This list was replicated several places throughout the docs.
I merged in information from those other lists and replaced
them with a link to this list.

0500-nic-usage.rst was out of place at the end of this section
  so I pulled the Neutron information (that was under "Technical
  Considerations" later in this doc) up so it follows this material
  and included this file after that material.  Additional reorganization
  of the networking docs is deferred until a later release, but this
  puts one piece of that project in its proper location.

  The "Technical Considerations" intro was pointless and superfluous
  so I deleted it and restructured the files a bit, so the 6050-neutron*
  file begins with the content that was previously in the neutron-intro/
  0100-neutron-vs-nova file.  6050 now includes the intro content for
  this section, followed by the include lines that were previously in
  the 0060-* file.

Moved "Storage" above "Logical Networks".  This puts the OVS stuff right
  after Network Topologies.  Ultimately, the whole doc will flow with
  Big Picture, Controllers, Compute nodes, Storage, Networking.

Change-Id: I5d202f8c314018a4a14c8e01d56af4be835b4ce3

commit_message:
A proposal for network policy

Group based policy abstraction has a many powerful abstraction models,
and it covers many use cases. However, it needs some additional
resources even if simple use cases.
This bp provide a simplified policy model with primitive
functionaries.

Change-Id: Iec2c27c70f76f2a149968e784b42de7bbf90ebb1

commit_message:
Add ability to use an exclusion list when selecting tempest tests

Useful for 3rd party CIs where not all tempest tests pass in their configuration.

The intention of this change is to allow moving of the exclusion lists to tempest
so if a new test is added that passes in gate it can be excluded from 3rd party
CIs without there being a period of breakage

Change-Id: Ice0560c3c2e73783f54693b238e0814658cbf4f0

commit_message:
Deprecate old SQL parameters

SQL configuration has changed in Havana.
This patch aims to deprecate old parameters and configure using the
right way.

subject: Turns off ambari and hadoop2 services for initial VM boot in HDP images
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7555, 'name': 'Matthew Farrellee', 'email': 'matt@redhat.com', 'username': 'farrellee'}, {'_account_id': 7732, 'name': 'IvanBerezovskiy', 'email': 'ivan.berezovskii@gmail.com', 'username': 'iberezovskiy'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}, {'_account_id': 9499, 'name': 'Robert Nettleton', 'email': 'rnettleton@hortonworks.com', 'username': 'rnettleton'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-07 22:16:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hadoop-hdp/post-install.d/58-turn-off-hadoop-2-services', 'elements/hadoop-hdp/post-install.d/55-turn-off-ambari-services'], 'message': "Turns off ambari and hadoop2 services for initial VM boot in HDP images

This patch resolves a minor bug in the HDP image generation scripts.

Some warning and error messages show up in the boot.log for VM
  instances based on the HDP images (v1.3.2 and v2.0.6).  The
  warnings involve the ambari-server startup, as well as the
  startup of some Hadoop 2 services in the v2.0.6 image.

The basic problem is that these services should not be starting
  upon the first boot of the image, since the HDP plugin has
  not yet configured the VM instances for a cluster startup.

The ambari-server and ambari-agent services have been turned off
  by default in this patch, by using the chkconfig command.  This keeps
  the ambari services from starting at first boot. This is desired,
  since the Ambari services don't have the configuration required
  during initial boot to function properly.

The same issue occurs with the Hadoop 2 services, and these are
  turned off using the same chkconfig mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1317270

Change-Id: I5fdd45a41b2e6bb8f9b632594bbd6ee538e09512
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Turns off ambari and hadoop2 services for initial VM boot in HDP images

This patch resolves a minor bug in the HDP image generation scripts.

Some warning and error messages show up in the boot.log for VM
  instances based on the HDP images (v1.3.2 and v2.0.6).  The
  warnings involve the ambari-server startup, as well as the
  startup of some Hadoop 2 services in the v2.0.6 image.

The basic problem is that these services should not be starting
  upon the first boot of the image, since the HDP plugin has
  not yet configured the VM instances for a cluster startup.

The ambari-server and ambari-agent services have been turned off
  by default in this patch, by using the chkconfig command.  This keeps
  the ambari services from starting at first boot. This is desired,
  since the Ambari services don't have the configuration required
  during initial boot to function properly.

The same issue occurs with the Hadoop 2 services, and these are
  turned off using the same chkconfig mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1317270

Change-Id: I5fdd45a41b2e6bb8f9b632594bbd6ee538e09512

commit_message:
Run DROPDB when server is not running

This fix covers 90% (20 out of 22) deadlocks have been seen in test logs.
One case was caused by 'dropdb' in cli tests themselves.
We should get rid of 'dropdb' in cli tests to avoid these deadlocks.
One another case doesn't seem to be connected with this issue.
test_task_managers.test_deletion_during_deployment test refactored.

Closes-Bug: #1317432

Change-Id: Id11785103db392d41b0d0c35223fe4476ac8e85f

commit_message:
Inherit V2 keypair API's tests from V3 tests

There is a lot of copy&paste test code for Nova v2/v3 API tests.
In addition, we need to add many checks for API test coverage.
As the result, we should apply the same changes to v2 and v3 tests.

This patch reuse the test code between V2 and V3 Keypair APIs
Inheriting the V2 Keypair API's test from V3 tests.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-test-inheritance

Change-Id: Ibe170a00e27619827678a1bbe104623ca24a81a3

commit_message:
Add test for subnet gateway IPv4 and IPv6

Four tests were added for testing neutron subnets with and
without gateway defined as a subnet attribute (gateway_ip)

Change-Id: I7862da41e62a47c274f170d29ceeeaeb89b2c976
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-attributes

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-19 18:38:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remember the DN

Many LDAP based calls are looking up objects multiple times.

If the search scope is sub, converting from object to id requires a lookup
which is wasteful.  Instead, add the DN to the object, and filter it off
before returning it to the end user.

Change-Id: I2b740412b6ca38dafceb29c6b35556b5869b1658

commit_message:
Reduce excess LDAP searches

Many LDAP based calls are looking up user and group
entries multiple times when it is not necessary.

Converting from a user or group object to a DN requires
a lookup which is wasteful.  Instead, we add the DN to
the object and filter it off before returning it to the
end user.

There were also search operations being performed before
issuing modify operations in an attempt to check if the
entry exists.  The modify operations can just be attempted
and we can check for an LDAP NO_SUCH_OBJECT exception
instead.  This reduces the number of search operations
that we need to perform.

The remove_user_from_group method in the SQL identity
driver did not match the other drivers with regards to
the exceptions it returns when the user or group does
not exist.  Since new tests were added to check these
exceptions, the SQL driver was modified to match the
behavior of the other drivers.

The LDAP version of test_attribute_update is skipped as
part of this patch as it was causing failures in the
live_tests.  It tests Blank values in a required field
which is an error in LDAP.

Closes-Bug: 1230260
Co-Authored By: Nathan Kinder <nkinder@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2b740412b6ca38dafceb29c6b35556b5869b1658

commit_message:
Big Switch: Check source_address attribute exists

Check that the source_address attribute exists on
HTTPSConnection objects before referencing it since
it's not present on python 2.6 deployments. If it
does not exist, create a socket connection without
specifying the source.

Closes-Bug: #1316382
Change-Id: Ica10d23cc6de81ae56f711937f208c7321c77f36

commit_message:
Unit test case for more than 1 ephemeral disks in BDM

The following patch modifies the test case for
_get_instance_block_device_info to handle more than 1 ephemeral
disks in the BDM.  This is to address one of the comments made
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/90583/ after it was already
approved for merger.  This patch also corrects a comment in
_get_instance_block_device_info to be more accurate.

Change-Id: I11e97f2e2ef999fa08af1693483d56bf8ad0e556
Closes-Bug: #1317321

commit_message:
Erase beginning of all partitions when erasing nodes

When re-deploying nodes with an identical disk layout previous
filesystems can cause problems with Ceph.

Change-Id: I3507472e805278924daff89a146dfdf7f89b4f3c
Closes-bug: #1317296

commit_message:
Add API v3 endpoint support

Nova API v3 is now by default in Icehouse. This patch aims to add the
ability to create the endpoint or not.

Change-Id: I66c6c9b439f8320cd56b6899d02bbe01b80f7243

(cherry picked from commit 00ed6139ec7346b7a1d9f42e94de72901006d089)

commit_message:
Refuse to bootstrap Percona when there is no metadata present

When relying on Heat metadata and OS:Heat:SoftwareDeployment, we can't
guarantee metadata is available upon the first os-collect-config run.

This can lead to both the "BOOTSTRAP_NODE" and "MY_HOST" variables
containing empty strings, which will be equal when compared on every
node.

Change-Id: I450c3741c4fe39982b6ef24e3a63555a0801051a

commit_message:
Allow nova to use different configuration files

The idea is to give a way to specify different configuration files for the
different nova services.

If a different configuration file is provided in the
os-apply-config/etc/nova folder the related service will be started using
both the common nova.conf and the service specific file.

Change-Id: Ie35041eb38a9b9305495bdd1afd57672db2af237

[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove logging in libvirt _connect_auth_cb to avoid eventlet locking

The _connect_auth_cb callback is logging a warning if credentials are
passed to the method from libvirt when connecting, but the comment right
above where the connection method is called on libvirt, it says don't do
any logging in that function because it can cause issues with how
eventlet does logging.

This has probably never been an issue because libvirt hasn't passed
credentials back to the callback, but if it did at some point we could
have a nasty locking problem so let's clean it up now.

See commit e4b0d8e9 for some related history.

commit_message:
Remove logging in libvirt _connect_auth_cb to avoid eventlet locking

The _connect_auth_cb callback is logging a warning if credentials are
passed to the method from libvirt when connecting, but the comment right
above where the connection method is called on libvirt, it says don't do
any logging in that function because it can cause issues with how
eventlet does logging.

This has probably never been an issue because libvirt hasn't passed
credentials back to the callback, but if it did at some point we could
have a nasty locking problem so let's clean it up now.

See commit e4b0d8e9 for some related history.

The nested method is moved up a level so it can be tested directly.

Change-Id: Ie47aabbf81c5aeda9e12e1c9acc11f6c70c4bea7

commit_message:
Add Nova API Sample file & test for get keypair

This patch adds the new API Sample file and its test for Nova V2 and V3
get keypair APIs.

This patch extend the timstamps reg exp to allow the combination
of TZ and microsecond/

Closes-Bug: 1298769
Closes-Bug: 1298818

Change-Id: If695a23cf95862b7bec6fbc5bdf7fc1733d08d4a

commit_message:
Remove unused nova.crypto.compute_md5()

Remove nova.crypto.compute_md5() as it is:
 * unused
  * last user removed 3 years ago with commit bab3060
 * untested
 * incorrectly documented
  * return type is not a tuple, but a string
 * redundant
  * copied from boto which is a nova requirement
 * burdened with license text more verbose than associated code

Change-Id: Ia033d3359098fc0af8de00248dc14b4fe280e844

commit_message:
Revert "Remove auth_strategy from nova.conf"

This reverts commit a3fdcba84f6f3d6e47ee112b934a839773f27582.

While trunk Nova has indeed made the referenced changed to default to
keystone, Icehouse has not, and we want to deploy current stable +
trunk from TripleO trunk.

Closes-Bug: #1317854
Change-Id: I42acc3851811703960feb40bc4ce0e895ee57c05

subject: Enable log messages to handle exceptions containing unicode
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-24 15:13:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable log messages to handle exceptions containing unicode

Currently the format string is a normal string, which in
py2x is not unicode.  When the unicode exception information is
used to replace the %s, str() is called on it, but because
it is unicode str() fails.  Making the format string translatable
ensures that it is correct for both py2x and py3x.

The exception will contain unicode when the exception being
returned by the other project is either translated to a
language using unicode characters or when lazy translation
is enabled and a gettextutils.Message instance is returned.

Change-Id: I1706f5eb9dfbee434f8882b03dad4674d955c370
Closes-Bug: #1310397
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-24 15:32:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'Enable log messages to handle exceptions containing unicode

Currently the format string is a normal string, which in
py2x is not unicode.  When the unicode exception information is
used to replace the %s, str() is called on it, but because
it is unicode str() fails.  Making the format string unicode
fixes this.  For the error log this is done by making it
translatable and for the debug message by explicity making
it unicode.

The exception will contain unicode when the exception being
returned by the other project is either translated to a
language using unicode characters or when lazy translation
is enabled and a gettextutils.Message instance is returned.

Change-Id: I1706f5eb9dfbee434f8882b03dad4674d955c370
Closes-Bug: #1310397
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Enable log messages to handle exceptions containing unicode

Currently the format string is a normal string, which in
py2x is not unicode.  When the unicode exception information is
used to replace the %s, str() is called on it, but because
it is unicode str() fails.  Making the format string unicode
fixes this.  For the error log this is done by making it
translatable and for the debug message by explicity making
it unicode.

The exception will contain unicode when the exception being
returned by the other project is either translated to a
language using unicode characters or when lazy translation
is enabled and a gettextutils.Message instance is returned.

Change-Id: I1706f5eb9dfbee434f8882b03dad4674d955c370
Closes-Bug: #1310397

commit_message:
Security guide editorial edits

No textual changes, just markup and style, mainly:
* Add missing <filename> markup
* Change capitalization
* Wrap some overly long lines
* Remove extra whitespace before ":"
* Replace "--" with emdash

commit_message:
Make baremetal driver use Instance object for updates

This makes the baremetal driver use the Instance object it is passed
to do its update instead of using the old conductor raw method.

Related to blueprint virt-objects-juno

Change-Id: I4116f1645562353134534dc6b883e8052c1aa706

subject: Clean up network resources before rescheduling an instance
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-09 15:33:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Clean up network resources before rescheduling an instance

It a failure occurs during instance creation, the instance can
be rescheduled. If a port was created during the first trial, this
port persists and should be cleaned up, before trying to create a
new one during the next trial

Change-Id: Ia0abb338df458951706ee9b35cbd77891ee7b2e0
Partial-Bug: #1160442
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean up network resources before rescheduling an instance

It a failure occurs during instance creation, the instance can
be rescheduled. If a port was created during the first trial, this
port persists and should be cleaned up, before trying to create a
new one during the next trial

Change-Id: Ia0abb338df458951706ee9b35cbd77891ee7b2e0
Partial-Bug: #1160442

subject: Add more fixed ips
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-08 19:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Add more fixed ips

Go from 256 to 4096 fixed IP addresses.

The large ops test spins up 3 sets of instances then deletes them all at
the end. We are working on bumping the large-ops number up from 50 to
175, so we will need at least 525 fixed ip addresses.

Change-Id: Ie6cfd6e191ec873e577166e33e94b5996190a1c2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add more fixed ips

Go from 256 to 4096 fixed IP addresses.

The large ops test spins up 3 sets of instances then deletes them all at
the end. We are working on bumping the large-ops number up from 50 to
175, so we will need at least 525 fixed ip addresses.

Change-Id: Ie6cfd6e191ec873e577166e33e94b5996190a1c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-08 19:11:49.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_api/test_middleware.py', 'designate/api/middleware.py'], 'message': "Allow Roles to be Passed When Using Noauth Middleware

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow Roles to be Passed When Using Noauth Middleware

Allows a user to pass roles to the noauth middleware, instead of
noauth automatically meaning that all users are admins. Doesn't change
the default behavior.

Change-Id: I1b90ae0e482d595cdac0c7620a9697d3d9df77ed

commit_message:
Ability to turn off ldap referral chasing

When getting an ldap connection, check a config property to see if
referral chasing should be turned off.

Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3bb5cc11b3c5c9108cfa656d5f5de1eaeb103fe5
Closes-Bug: 1233365

subject: Inherit V2 API's flavors tests from V3 tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-07 08:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/v3/flavors/test_flavors.py', 'tempest/api/compute/flavors/test_flavors.py'], 'message': "Inherit V2 API's flavors tests from V3 tests

There is a lot of copy&paste test code for Nova v2/v3 API tests.
In addition, we need to add many checks for API test coverage.
As the result, we should apply the same changes to v2 and v3 tests.

This patch reuse the test code of flavors APIs between V2 and V3
Inheriting the V2 flavors API's test from V3 tests.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-test-inheritance

Change-Id: I85463baec7af1e4e8bcc6310804fd15c1958d7ed
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Inherit V2 API's flavors tests from V3 tests

There is a lot of copy&paste test code for Nova v2/v3 API tests.
In addition, we need to add many checks for API test coverage.
As the result, we should apply the same changes to v2 and v3 tests.

This patch reuse the test code of flavors APIs between V2 and V3
Inheriting the V2 flavors API's test from V3 tests.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-test-inheritance

commit_message:
create test and worker summary report

a summary report that includes counts of the test results so far
as well as a worker report to let us understand how our workers
are balanced at the moment, as well as if we are missing worker
0 in our data (which seems to happen quite often).

Change-Id: Ide0b63b86e87f8a18c2f0e45264692ac3797c791

subject: Clean up openstack-common.conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-04 04:12:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/py3kcompat/urlutils.py', 'heat/openstack/common/py3kcompat/__init__.py', 'openstack-common.conf'], 'message': 'Clean up openstack-common.conf

oslo-incubator will introduce new integrity check in [1].
That will help developer find inconsistent issue while copying
from oslo-incubator. The check just outputs warnings. These are
changes according to warning:
 * remove unused module py3kcompat
 * add missing module context, processutils in openstack-common.conf
 * sort the modules in openstack-common.conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76901/

Change-Id: I2fea01148f6ad268a5fcfdaa788e30d6fcb48c3f
Related-Bug: #1295582
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean up openstack-common.conf

oslo-incubator will introduce new integrity check in [1].
That will help developer find inconsistent issue while copying
from oslo-incubator. The check just outputs warnings. These are
changes according to warning:
 * remove unused module py3kcompat
 * add missing module context, processutils in openstack-common.conf
 * sort the modules in openstack-common.conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76901/

Change-Id: I2fea01148f6ad268a5fcfdaa788e30d6fcb48c3f
Related-Bug: #1295582

commit_message:
Add glanceclient to heat

To enable implementation of a glance image resource, we first need to add
access to glanceclient in heat.

Change-Id: Ie0623e0307f6d3163ae584ceab89453f71f48053
Implements: blueprint glance-image

subject: Allow token revocation list to be unimplemented
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-29 17:01:44.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Allow token revocation list to be unimplemented

The /v2.0/tokens/revoked resource does not exist in the API contract
and thus should not be a required resource. A recent change makes this
resource an integral part of validating tokens. If your Keystone
installation doesn't support /v2.0/tokens/revoked then every token
validation will fail.

Change-Id: I6bbe8a8993d0bdf91e4b60996b132c68f67d1d85
Closes-Bug: 1314285
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow token revocation list to be unimplemented

The /v2.0/tokens/revoked resource does not exist in the API contract
and thus should not be a required resource. A recent change makes this
resource an integral part of validating tokens. If your Keystone
installation doesn't support /v2.0/tokens/revoked then every token
validation will fail.

Change-Id: I6bbe8a8993d0bdf91e4b60996b132c68f67d1d85
Closes-Bug: 1314285

commit_message:
Add oauthlib library to stable/havana requirements

We need to add oauthlib to stable/havana because when we previously
merged https://review.openstack.org/#/c/81980/ it had caused gate
breaks.

https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg19415.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-26 15:41:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rabbitmq-server/install.d/20-rabbitmq-server'], 'message': 'RabbitMQ: Sync upstart with original sysvinit script

* Run under the rabbitmq user/group
* Ensure PID directory exists
* Pass PID file path as an env var
* `rabbitmqctl wait` requires the pidfile as an argument

Change-Id: Ia1232347d4434a5eada7120746f6e26a9ba68322
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ: Sync upstart with original sysvinit script

* Run under the rabbitmq user/group
* Ensure PID directory exists
* Pass PID file path as an env var
* `rabbitmqctl wait` requires the pidfile as an argument

Change-Id: Ia1232347d4434a5eada7120746f6e26a9ba68322

Document cinder API service multi-process config

setting to increase the throughput of the Block Storage API service.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-09 06:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml'], 'message': 'Setup the Qpid access for ceilometer on RHEL

The default setting for rpc_backend is the kombu implementation, we need
to make sure that qpid is used on RHEL-like systems.

Change-Id: Ifef49622ad9043072a0cd9c102a9afcba305ec66
Closes-Bug: #1317502
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Setup the Qpid access for ceilometer on RHEL

The default setting for rpc_backend is the kombu implementation, we need
to make sure that qpid is used on RHEL-like systems.

Change-Id: Ifef49622ad9043072a0cd9c102a9afcba305ec66
Closes-Bug: #1317502

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-29 09:29:27.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_testenv.sh', 'scripts/install-dependencies', 'scripts/devtest_setup.sh', 'scripts/cleanup-env', 'scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Allow a configurable power-off of nodes using IPMI

before deploying images to the nodes. This is similar to cleaning

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Allow a configurable power-off of nodes using IPMI

Add the ability to power-off all nodes using IPMI power management
before deploying images to the nodes. This is similar to cleaning
up the VM however we delay the clean-up till much latter in the
process to allow all node to be added to the environment.

Change-Id: Id6241042914c5e99bcb44aa70b87ea2490c41216

commit_message:
add test to ensure there are no \r

some of the specs are coming in with literal \r characters,
probably from being created in windows notepad. This makes reading
the specs very cumbersome. We should test against these.

Change-Id: I59ed022e882cfde00c004a66659a43134fd2df5c

commit_message:
Introduce configurable virtual ip in templates

added ControlVirtualIP resource of type OS::Neutron::Port

Added ControlVirtualInterface - by default br-ex

To specify the IP address to use as ControlVirtualIP,
or for any others custom needs, you could provide:

-P 'ControlFixedIPs=[{"ip_address" : "192.0.2.251"}]'

Related to blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration

Change-Id: Ie82750ac1537c80311a869880f636bda59ca5c58

commit_message:
Simplify calls to ImageCache in PXE module

This is a simple refactoring to reduce amount of typing when
accessing two kinds of image caches: TFTP and instance images.
It will also make easier to have separate caching settings
for TFTP and instance images caches, if required in the future.

Change-Id: Id3ce989fceb2ee31a93a57d4bdfceaa946b66ff5

commit_message:
Transparently handle sys- vs extlinux

Handle the boot loader configuration and installation properly based on
whether syslinux or extlinux is installed. And also add kernel parameters to
disable graphics.

Tested with Debian jessie/testing.

Change-Id: I73b5f036fcd4a5e60a407d06eb8d8a4a8ce5481d

commit_message:
Add a squid element.

From the Squid man page:

squid is a high-performance proxy caching server for web clients,
supporting  FTP,  gopher,  ICAP,  ICP, HTCP and HTTP data objects.
Unlike traditional caching software, Squid handles all requests in a
single, non-blocking process.

We are considering using this as part of our CI overclouds
for caching.

Change-Id: I8eb006ab0af731587bfb0a99659f6dc8bed42fc7

commit_message:
Use FHS-compliant default base directory

/opt/stack as the default base directory is not very friendly to
non-OpenStack users, so this changes the default base directory
to reside in /usr/libexec.  The /opt/stack path will continue to
work for now so any existing users will not be broken by the change.

Also changes the directory name from os-config-refresh to
os-refresh-config to better align with the os-apply-config naming.

Change-Id: I98e93d91685ae25ae74a5470483a1cc8b97da4e5

commit_message:
Adding -x to set parameters for more output

When the cache tarball gets fail the output doesn't indicate
what url is failing.  Adding '-x' displays the urls attempted.

Change-Id: I71b2dbfd712e72c591410ca9b68edc76d493ad6e

commit_message:
Add set-bootable command

Bootable Status is set to "True" automatically when user
create a volume from a image. But user have to set bootable
status manually when creating a bootable volume manually.

blueprint add-bootable-option

this commit is related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/83691/

Change-Id: Ib6cdca15950fe86b4fb2a43cfc7338e28260e453

subject: Correction of tempest verification
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-30 13:10:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Revert direct usage of subunit

Test repository should be used as launcher for tempest tests, since direct
usage of `subunit` broke execution of `compute` set as well as `full` set.
Tests discovery and execution can't be split at the moment.

Also, execution of tempest sets cannot be correct without confidence in
correct installation of tempest repository. Cleanup of tempest folder after
faulty installation should be added to fix check of tempest installation.

Change-Id: I68660e38f2cae3f60a01e99cdbbb57bdb8a9bb04

1) Revert direct usage of subunit

Test repository should be used as launcher for tempest tests, since direct
usage of `subunit` broke execution of `compute` set as well as `full` set.

2) Cleanup of tempest folder afterfaulty installation

commit_message:
Correction of tempest verification

1) Revert direct usage of subunit

Test repository should be used as launcher for tempest tests, since direct
usage of `subunit` broke execution of `compute` set as well as `full` set.
Tests discovery and execution can't be split at the moment.

2) Cleanup of tempest folder afterfaulty installation

Also, execution of tempest sets cannot be correct without confidence in
correct installation of tempest repository. Cleanup of tempest folder after
faulty installation should be added to fix check of tempest installation.

3) Length of database field for verification results

MutableJSONEncodedDict limited by 64k. This length is not sufficient for
storage results of those verifications, which have a huge number of failures
and tracebacks.

4) Incorrect usage of mock in tests

Class `mock.MagicMock` doesn't have method `assert_called_once`.
Instead of this one, method `assert_called_once_with` should be used.
Based on the fact that this is critical error in testing, this patch
affects not only tempest verification.

Change-Id: I68660e38f2cae3f60a01e99cdbbb57bdb8a9bb04
Closes-Bug: #1313744
Closes-Bug: #1313742
Closes-Bug: #1305991

commit_message:
Allow to provide default password when invoke get_secret for develop mode

We need provide an option to specify a password when invoke the
get_secret instead of to return the value of index directly.
We can use the attribute node['openstack']['secret'][index] to save the
password.

Implements: blueprint vmware-password-databag
Change-Id: Ie9421b60f8a6b38a976941c1fe9c33c2962f091e

commit_message:
Permit overriding the mysql InnoDB pool size.

For VMs we need a small pool - e.g. 100MB. For production environments
folk will likely want a much larger pool size. Ideally we would set
The Right Value automatically, but as an interim step, make it
possible to set a custom value again in devtest_*.

Change-Id: Id595113a52f5a1da740bd81a4cf7932c96d57754

commit_message:
Discuss security impact of Memory Optimization Technologies

Removed KSM from the list of 'security features' for hypervisor
technology and added a discussion of KSM and TPS.

Change-Id: Iaedb90f84f74836ccce24a4a63402f429845635d
Closes-Bug: #1311204

subject: Pin RPC client version min == max
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-07 23:06:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Pin RPC client version min == max

At the moment, ironic's rpcapi module is specifying a target (minimum)
RPC version of 1.0 -- however, none of the methods added after 1.0
indicate in which minor version they were added. Thus, this module
believes all methods are available in any version of the server greater
than 1.0, which is clearly untrue.

This change pins the target version to the current version,
effectively preventing rolling upgrades, which are not supported at the
moment anyway.

Change-Id: I031ccd13d1d140821daf8a0adf5913627064451c
Partial-fix: #1317300
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-08 15:46:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Pin RPC client version min == max

At the moment, ironic's rpcapi module is specifying a target (minimum)
RPC version of 1.0 -- however, none of the methods added after 1.0
indicate in which minor version they were added. Thus, this module
believes all methods are available in any version of the server greater
than 1.0, which is clearly untrue.

This change pins the target version to the current version,
effectively preventing rolling upgrades, which are not supported at the
moment anyway.

Change-Id: I031ccd13d1d140821daf8a0adf5913627064451c
Partial-Bug: #1317300
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Pin RPC client version min == max

At the moment, ironic's rpcapi module is specifying a target (minimum)
RPC version of 1.0 -- however, none of the methods added after 1.0
indicate in which minor version they were added. Thus, this module
believes all methods are available in any version of the server greater
than 1.0, which is clearly untrue.

This change pins the target version to the current version,
effectively preventing rolling upgrades, which are not supported at the
moment anyway.

Change-Id: I031ccd13d1d140821daf8a0adf5913627064451c
Partial-Bug: #1317300

commit_message:
NSX: fix API payloads for dhcp/metadata setup

NSX 4.2 GA has tweaked the way dhcp and metadata
ports are configured. This patch takes care of
that.

Closes-bug: #1312822

Change-Id: I4e8496bf721c0f35df4228ec9c6f8066275e8c7a
(cherry picked from commit bfdec043f1429ac4aa884e9422861b4e6c1ca815)

commit_message:
api: add image_cache_dir parameter

Without image_cache_dir parameter, Glance API can't start.
Default value is set to /var/lib/glance/cache.

Change-Id: I1cfcbf0021cfae187d9c8d78a16b18de29c97b4a
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-13 15:36:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Resolves volume resize issue

Reasons:
- Cinder APIs are not able to complete the detach/attach properly with
  nova instance.
- resize2fs is not proceeding with "-f" and "-n" options.

Changes:
- Used nova-volume attach-detach APIs instead of cinder APIs.
- Updated e2fsck to use -p option to complete the e2fsck action so that
  resize2fs could proceed.

Change-Id: I40f1dc8ca04b3bfcc4eae910515fcedf922c1a9e
Closes-Bug: #1291896

commit_message:
Resolves volume resize issue

Reasons:
- Cinder APIs are not able to complete the detach/attach properly with
  nova instance.
- resize2fs is not proceeding with e2fsck having "-f" and "-n" options.

Changes:
- Used nova-volume attach-detach APIs instead of cinder APIs.
- Updated e2fsck to use -p option to complete the e2fsck action so that
  resize2fs could proceed.
- Updated tests as per replaced Nova APIs instead of Cinder APIs.

Change-Id: I40f1dc8ca04b3bfcc4eae910515fcedf922c1a9e
Closes-Bug: #1291896

commit_message:
Make a top level contrib doc header

This is to just make it clear that there are other resources
besides Rackspace ones.

This is not really a bug as both the rackspace and docker
headings are the same level, but when going to the page it
is easy to see why the bug was made.

Change-Id: I76a8bcf63b7c976c4fcf0baecfd58e5fcbb65d96
Fixes-bug: #1311565

commit_message:
Add an init-keystone CLI

To allow devtest to leverage the keystone initialization in this
module, add a CLI script called init-keystone.

Change-Id: I733fb1319b81ebc69845b08bd8ed9a933fa5d245

commit_message:
Set NODE_CNT to 15 and add OVERCLOUD_CONTROLSCALE

Adding the ability to specify multiple control nodes for merge.py. This
requires additional testenv node definitions so setting there to be a
default of 15 nodes defined. This should prevent us from re-deploying CI
testenv's when the number of nodes needed changes in the future.

This change depends on I70ef83f35064ab388bdc7e1a6da62b6585580010

Change-Id: Icff5e728148f2744f3fc7c6e99d744be9fda180b

[{'created': '2014-05-08 01:23:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't check for nova usability when we use glance

We are only using glance in build_app and we are passing in the correct
glance endpoint (but not for nova), so this nova check will always fail.
Instead check for glance usability.

Change-Id: I78a83462ac9424afc84fef797c94fea6e531e78d
Fixes-bug: #1316290
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-09 01:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/lp-cedarish/vm-slug/build-app'], 'message': "Don't check for nova useablity when we use glance

We are only using glance and we are only passing in the glance endpoint,
so this nova check will always fail. Instead check for glance usability.

Fixes-bug: #1316290
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't check for nova useablity when we use glance

We are only using glance and we are only passing in the glance endpoint,
so this nova check will always fail. Instead check for glance usability.

Change-Id: I78a83462ac9424afc84fef797c94fea6e531e78d
Fixes-bug: #1316290

commit_message:
Fix v3 API extension names for camelcase

Most v3 API names are camelcase, but few APIs are not.
This patch changes them to camelcase for the consistency.

Change-Id: I0dc6c23ffcdcf97fc52d3575d521692805ffd9e3
Closes-Bug: #1315597

[{'created': '2014-04-02 07:06:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Verify the response attributes of 'aggregate-add-host' API

This patch verifies the response attributes of 'aggregate-add-host'.
The response attributes of v2 and v3 are the same:
{
    "aggregate": {
        "availability_zone": "nova",
        "created_at": "2012-12-04T12:04:24.399784",
        "deleted": false,
        "deleted_at": null,
        "hosts": [
            "0438c6a4e8d841ad823b801d681f4680"
        ],
        "id": 1,
        "metadata": {
            "availability_zone": "nova"
        },
        "name": "name",
        "updated_at": null
    }
}
The status_code is different:
v2 -> 200, v3 -> 202

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

commit_message:
Verify the response attributes of 'aggregate-add-remove-host' API

This patch verifies the response attributes of 'aggregate-add-remove-host'.
The response attributes of v2 and v3 are the same:
{
    "aggregate": {
        "availability_zone": "nova",
        "created_at": "2012-12-04T12:04:24.399784",
        "deleted": false,
        "deleted_at": null,
        "hosts": [],
        "id": 1,
        "metadata": {
            "availability_zone": "nova"
        },
        "name": "name",
        "updated_at": null
    }
}
The status_code is different:
v2 -> 200, v3 -> 202

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I6f6bdc458f15f8af812fee6926e5133df09f9fa1

commit_message:
Updates to the 'Log in to the dashboard' section

Updated to reflect the following changes:
- New screenshots for the dashboard-admin and dashboard-project tabs
- Included info about Host Aggregates
- Changes to the Resource Usage tab
- Minor updates like 'Images & Snapshots' to 'Images'.
Partial-Bug: #1307860

Change-Id: I8deb81fc94fd115944bebd835dd17d39fbf43ffd

changes according to warning:

 * fix wrong module db.sqlachemy in openstack-common.conf

commit_message:
Clean up openstack-common.conf

This patch clean up unused module and wrong module name.
The issues are detected by new change about update.py
in I68c0108304be8a315bcefe939c22019caab9bc98. This patch
doesn't depend the oslo-incubator patch.
 * remove unused module sslutils, versionutils
 * fix wrong module db.sqlachemy in openstack-common.conf

Change-Id: I55affbb398d97b1da8c15576ae1c54f27e6ad714

subject: Move most undercloud params to an environment file

[{'created': '2014-05-02 01:40:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move most undercloud params to an environment file

This is my effort to replicate new changes from overcloud
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/88153/3 to undercloud as well.
Heat environment files give us a way to serialise the parameters
needed to update a stack easily. This reduces one of the most annoying
bits about high frequency stack-updates.

commit_message:
Move most undercloud params to an environment file

This is my effort to replicate new changes from overcloud
I26f91980971fd4598b043bdb764359ac32a3c42a to undercloud as well.
Heat environment files give us a way to serialise the parameters
needed to create a stack easily.

Change-Id: I8ff50ca092e1209167cd9818b680f56a7512bba3

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a common admin class for Nova v2/v3 API tests

For improving the maintenancebility, this patch adds a common admin
class to share it between v2 and v3 tests. In addition, this patch
applies this class to test_availability_zone of v2 and v3 as a sample.

After applying this class to all Nova API tests, we will be able
to remove current BaseV2ComputeAdminTest and BaseV3ComputeAdminTest
classes.

Change-Id: Iede054d45c18922102cdf17938fde0e33f1df16c

commit_message:
Add a common admin class for Nova v2/v3 API tests

For improving the maintenance, this patch changes a common admin class
to share it between v2 and v3 tests. In addition, this patch applies
this class to test_availability_zone of v2 and v3 as a sample.

After applying this class to all Nova API tests, we will be able
to remove current BaseV2ComputeAdminTest and BaseV3ComputeAdminTest
classes.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-test-inheritance

Change-Id: Iede054d45c18922102cdf17938fde0e33f1df16c

commit_message:
Move to newer version of python-swiftclient

The 2.0.x release of python-swiftclient includes SSL certificate
verification. This is desired for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/75927/

Change-Id: I3d6371a31c07c4e31da72edf9dd71537c8e58d23

commit_message:
Revert "Big Switch: Check source_address attribute exists"

This reverts commit 0dde14c0cd6ffea8ebff715342852ef17a9c0b70.

This fix only addressed part of the problem. The socket call
in python 2.6 does not accept an extra source address arg
either.

Change-Id: I4df4f66e9db0da1a8923ee37e918718f3bcf26ee
Partial-Bug: #1316382

commit_message:
NSX: ensure that no LSN is created on external networks

Logical Service Nodes (LSN) are those that provide dhcp
and metadata services to networks when the NSX plugin is
used without the openstack dhcp and metadata proxy
agents. External networks do not work with Neutron's
dhcp and metadata services, therefore there is no need
to provision a LSN in this case.

Added UT to avoid regression.

Closes-bug: #1316795

Change-Id: I3dab0c9cbecdd9296466c991d02d590d6bd5bd49

commit_message:
Exclude netifaces versions 0.10.0, 0.10.1

Add pin on netifaces dependency to exclude versions
0.10.0 & 0.10.1, as these versions fail to install on
sereval Linux distributions.

Change-Id: I4e5d210ed6cf5fcf5612e8600d3b144a4620034c
Related-to: #1315374

subject: Bump sqlalchemy-migrate version to 0.9.1
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-15 21:37:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Bump sqlalchemy-migrate version to 0.9

The latest version of sqlalchemy-migrate has support for sqlalchemy 0.9
and DB2.  Several core projects are supporting DB2 already so we should
bump the runtime requirement so the migrations work if you're running
against a DB2 backend.

Related blueprint db2-database

Change-Id: Iadb4a5dd67d7e4e5547b7185159ab687a4ef1b74
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-06 21:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump sqlalchemy-migrate version to 0.9.1

The latest version of sqlalchemy-migrate has support for sqlalchemy 0.9
and DB2.  Several core projects are supporting DB2 already so we should
bump the runtime requirement so the migrations work if you're running
against a DB2 backend.

This is also needed for oslo.db commit 567175554 to clean old migrate
monkey patches out of oslo.db since they live in migrate 0.9.1 now.

Related blueprint db2-database

Change-Id: Iadb4a5dd67d7e4e5547b7185159ab687a4ef1b74

commit_message:
Bump sqlalchemy-migrate version to 0.9.1

The latest version of sqlalchemy-migrate has support for sqlalchemy 0.9
and DB2.  Several core projects are supporting DB2 already so we should
bump the runtime requirement so the migrations work if you're running
against a DB2 backend.

This is also needed for oslo.db commit 567175554 to clean old migrate
monkey patches out of oslo.db since they live in migrate 0.9.1 now.

Related blueprint db2-database

Change-Id: Iadb4a5dd67d7e4e5547b7185159ab687a4ef1b74

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2014-05-05 15:59:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Deleting heat stack when deleting assembly

- Setting assembly status to DELETING
- Asynchronously calling heat stack delete

Setting assembly status to DELETING so that
if a concurrent GET request is received before
delete is completed, the requestor will know
that assembly is being deleted.

We don't need to worry about resetting the DELETING
status to something like DELETED by monitoring
when the deletion of all the components associated
with an assembly, including the heat stack, is complete.
This is because once an assembly object is deleted,
its status becomes a moot point (we will get 404
for GET requests).

Note: Once we start storing stack_id in the component
table we can rework this by avoiding the call to heat
to get the stack id.

Change-Id: I353de389a88385c9660bcbec4fc20463d2f0c8ee
Closes-bug: #1314626
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2014-05-05 20:38:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Deleting heat stack when deleting assembly

- Setting assembly status to DELETING
- Asynchronously calling heat stack delete
- Destroying the assembly object only if heat
  stack successfully got deleted.
  If stack delete errors out, setting the
  assembly status to ERROR_HEAT_STACK_DELETE

Notes:
1) If Heat stack-delete errors out, a stack with
   name = assembly_name will exist in the system
   (most likely in an indeterminate state). If
   Solum receives a subsequent call to create a
   new assembly with the same assembly name then
   Heat stack-creation most likely would error out
   because of the clashing stack name.

   One approach to solve this issue will be to append
   assembly_id to the assembly_name when creating a
   heat stack

   Created bug for this: #1316304

2) Once we start storing stack_id in the component
   table we can avoid the call to heat to get
   the stack id.

Change-Id: I353de389a88385c9660bcbec4fc20463d2f0c8ee
Closes-bug: #1314626

commit_message:
Deleting heat stack when deleting assembly

- Setting assembly status to DELETING
- Asynchronously calling heat stack delete
- Destroying the assembly object only if heat
  stack successfully got deleted.
  If stack delete errors out, setting the
  assembly status to ERROR_HEAT_STACK_DELETE
- Added sleep to functionaltests to allows for
  children assemblies to be deleted before
  delete_plan is called.

Notes:
1) If Heat stack-delete errors out, a stack with
   name = assembly_name will exist in the system
   (most likely in an indeterminate state). If
   Solum receives a subsequent call to create a
   new assembly with the same assembly name then
   Heat stack-creation most likely would error out
   because of the clashing stack name.

   One approach to solve this issue will be to append
   assembly_id to the assembly_name when creating a
   heat stack

   Created bug for this: #1316304

2) Once we start storing stack_id in the component
   table we can avoid the call to heat to get
   the stack id.

Change-Id: I353de389a88385c9660bcbec4fc20463d2f0c8ee
Partial-bug: #1314626
Co-Authored-By: Arati Mahimane (arati.mahimane@rackspace.com)
 (Helped with testing functional test changes)

commit_message:
Fix deprecated_opts for cli options

The following simple program raises DuplicateOptError.
This commit fixes it.

oslo.config.cfg.DuplicateOptError: duplicate option: argument --bar-foo: conflicting option string(s): --bar-foo

    from oslo.config import cfg

    conf = cfg.ConfigOpts()
    oldopts = [
        cfg.DeprecatedOpt(name='oldfoo', group='oldbar'),
    ]
    conf.register_cli_opt(cfg.StrOpt(name='foo', deprecated_opts=oldopts),
                          group='bar')
    conf()

Change-Id: I022ed0236de97db42568106bc90c696732a05ef2
Closes-Bug: #1283960

commit_message:
Add the sbins to PATH

On fedora (and possibly other systems) sshd is compiled with
--with-default-path=/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin
for non interactive shells because /etc/profile isn't read this
results in PATH not including sbin.

For simplicity I append sbin to the current PATH regardless if it
already exists or not.

Change-Id: I5f6aecb2b1fa9c49f4d15c5d96c005607b05c803

commit_message:
Remove conductor usage from compute.utils.EventReporter

This makes compute.utils.EventReporter use the InstanceActionEvent
object instead of making raw conductor calls. Callers are changed to
stop passing conductor API to it.

In addition, moves helper methods pack_action_event*() from
compute.utils to objects.instance_action like previously was done
with pack_action_[start|finish]().

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I308959a1b206899369a10d391991124ef014c89f

commit_message:
Use version dir, not LATEST for Percona d/l path

The Percona download URL is pinned to a specific verson but LATEST is in
the path. This means new Percona releases cause 404's until we update the
version.

Also updating the version for good measure.

Change-Id: Ib21666b01f7ef9fd72eb0f868e8eb76d6832fe9e

commit_message:
Revert "Disable debug messages when running unit tests"

This reverts commit 56edda0d1840da1ccfcd7c35df397251ddb779db.

Another patch (commit-id: df96a03e6c74f1fceb4525900bca885307907b79) to
fix the same issue with less intrusive consequences was already merged
into master. There's still benefit to have debug logs if this does not
make gate jobs fail, so revert to previous setting value.

Related-Bug: 1316610
Change-Id: I9b57369027e1e43bed1bde4d971dee9fb7a26a47

commit_message:
Make VPNaaS 'InUse' exception more clear

In case IpSecPolicy or IKEPolicy is updated while VPN connection that uses it
is already established, IPsecPolicyInUse or IKEPolicuInUse is raised.
Need to clarify their messages to emphasize that policies can't be updated
because they are used by established connection.

Change-Id: I259f9b8bcff7f8ec13ac630285f6e881c6653309
Closes-Bug: #1315809

commit_message:
Add a FindMixin class to help with getting resources by name

Note: this is largely a copy of apiclient.base.ManagerWithFind
      but without the inheritance and the find() method which
      does not clash with the Manager find() - now called findone()
(tests are in the folowing commit)

Change-Id: I332f542a1bf372e239f7f4e6a760e3bffebb641c

commit_message:
move default_volume_type to cinder::api

In a previous commit, this parameter has been introduced in
cinder::backends, but it should be configured on Cinder API server.
This patch deprecated the old parameter.

Change-Id: Ic84c316dc80d8d778ce62df85a6b5bff4a18ead1
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit eccaa59fb9635c62d108029e797388d456e8f6c2)

Extend interface on InternalClient

 * add get_object
 * allow extra headers passthrough on HEAD/metadata reqeusts
 * expose (account|container|get_object)_ring properties

Pipeline propety access to the auto_create_account_prefix also allows us to
bypass the early exit on a container HEAD for auto_create_accounts if the
container-updater hasn't cycled yet.

Change-Id: I9b287d15f2426022d669d1186c9e22dd8ca13fb9

subject: Build raw image in separate tmpfs
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-01 10:46:46.000000000', 'files': ['lib/common-functions'], 'message': "Build raw image in separate tmpfs

If the tmpfs being used to hold the image filesystem is close to being
full then housing the raw disk image in the same place can be
problematic as it tends to grow faster then the filesystem shrinks when
data is being moved into it.

Putting them both into separate tmpfs's will allow there to be an
overlap where they jointly use more then the size limit for a singe tmpfs.

Change-Id: Ia17ca357d3b865d70a2d3e13e0479d008ca5f924
Closes-Bug: #1289582
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Build raw image in separate tmpfs

If the tmpfs being used to hold the image filesystem is close to being
full then housing the raw disk image in the same place can be
problematic as it tends to grow faster then the filesystem shrinks when
data is being moved into it.

Putting them both into separate tmpfs's will allow there to be an
overlap where they jointly use more then the size limit for a singe tmpfs.

Change-Id: Ia17ca357d3b865d70a2d3e13e0479d008ca5f924
Closes-Bug: #1289582

commit_message:
Use public gateway for Trove if neutron is enabled

Fix Trove to use the PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY if neutron is enabled.
This is needed since in this case the guestagent is able to reach
the devstack host only via the public PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY and
not via the private NETWORK_GATEWAY.

Change-Id: I61ee707e16d0222e7f479369e769cbe7ef2de7d7

Although features.yaml have a feature entry for qpid, there's no
config option for qpid. So, even if you have a DEVSTACK_GATE_QPID=1

This patch enable the use of DEVSTACK_GATE_QPID=1 to run devstack

Change-Id: Iffb6f5a8fef4caef7ae4e68aa261b3db63016493

commit_message:
Add qpid config

Although features.yaml have a feature entry for qpid, there's no
config option for qpid. So, even if you have a DEVSTACK_GATE_QPID=1
in your environment, it won't work.
This patch enable the use of DEVSTACK_GATE_QPID=1 to run devstack
with qpid instead of rabbit

Change-Id: Iffb6f5a8fef4caef7ae4e68aa261b3db63016493

commit_message:
Add Cinder v2 Keystone endpoint support

In Icehouse release, official API supported is v2 but Nova does not
support it at this time.

For now, we keep v1 endpoint for backward compatibility and let the
operator create a v2 endpoint.

Change-Id: I27264dff683c47560351235c8e398afe7c8df2f0
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Big Switch: Check source_address attribute exists

Check that the source_address attribute exists on
HTTPSConnection objects before referencing it since
it's not present on python 2.6 deployments.

Closes-Bug: #1316382
Change-Id: Id82e70f124cba73c33737099027b5c61aea713bb
(cherry picked from commit 0dde14c0cd6ffea8ebff715342852ef17a9c0b70)

commit_message:
Add WordPress example using software config

This patch adds two HOT example templates for WordPress using the new
software config feature added in Heat Icehouse.

The actual config scripts are provided as separate files that get
included into the templates using get_file.

There is one template to deploy WordPress on a single server, and
another template to deploy it on two servers. Both templates use
the same config scripts.

The templates have been tested with a Fedora 20 based image that
had image builder elements required for software config built in
(as described in a README in one of Steve Baker's pending changes
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84910 ).

I based the scripts on a pending change by Mike Spreitzer, so thanks
to him as well: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/88523

Change-Id: I63d8945fcb619b406093595073242a25bbb66387

commit_message:
Make vmwareapi/vmops use Instance object for updates

This converts the one use of virtapi.instance_update() in vmops to
use the Instance object instead of the old conductor method.
Unfortunately, the affected method was apparently not tested at all,
so this adds a simple test for it.

Related to blueprint virt-objects-juno

Change-Id: I21ed4903a0c8d98c8776d358d8273077cd979fdf

commit_message:
Add link to readme at bottom of docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/

The readme has important information so we want to make it discoverable
at http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/
Remove 'Further Reading' section in HACKING.rst since it's already in
the README.rst which is now linked at the bottom of
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/

Change-Id: I45c51494382283003f61fc416953a576efa7db60

commit_message:
Make python2.6 tests a noop

We do not ever intend for TripleO to be run on python 2.6 systems.

Change-Id: I7b5b2c8eb09d21b93b48b5aaa0528d281b0018eb

commit_message:
Enhancements to ml2_conf.ini

This change provides enhancements to the ml2_conf.ini image element
to make it more configurable for various ml2 plugin configurations.
The use of the ovs_neutron_plugin.ini as a parameter to
neutron-openvswitch-agent was also chnaged to use ml2_conf.ini.

Change-Id: I20e21cca8d0cf7ec5cb68d02071fea6f4a20456e

subject: Set MySQL Buffer Pool size low for testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-08 15:26:59.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'Set MySQL Buffer Pool size low for testing

In devtest, we need this to be very low as we expect small VMs. But in
production we will want a much larger default. We need to be explicit
here, so that we can raise the default in the element.

Change-Id: Ia3cbffa9e795d22e8eddcc44db7d1548e8d99c91
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set MySQL Buffer Pool size low for testing

In devtest, we need this to be very low as we expect small VMs. But in
production we will want a much larger default. We need to be explicit
here, so that we can raise the default in the element.

Change-Id: Ia3cbffa9e795d22e8eddcc44db7d1548e8d99c91

commit_message:
Ensure rabbitmq can be successfully restarted

We jump through many hoops in order to successfully restart rabbitmq.
This is mostly because we shift the rabbit PID file location, which
means that beam can't be correctly stopped.

Since we're installing static configuration, do that in the image
element rather than at runtime.

Then, ensure that rabbit isn't started until it's actually configured.

We do this in a fashion which is consistent with the operation of
os-svc-enable.

Change-Id: Ifee1dd90eb4db2c29a64864d1cc9fdc9cd3b1bfd

[{'created': '2014-05-01 03:28:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix cross policy versioning DELETE

In the object_versions section of proxy.controllers.obj's DELETE the
X-Storage-Policy-Index header was not being set on the correct request, which
ment you'd get a 404 when you tried to DELETE an object in a versioned
container.  The 404 was acctually coming from the request to cleanup the old
version after it had already been copied over the current version.

commit_message:
Fix cross policy versioning DELETE

In the object_versions section of proxy.controllers.obj's DELETE the
X-Storage-Policy-Index header was not being set on the correct request, which
ment you'd get a 404 when you tried to DELETE an object in a versioned
container.  The 404 was acctually coming from the request to cleanup the old
version after it had already been copied over the current version.

Change-Id: Ibbf57abf16bc38c02e5703113ce5a17fa2a7dae2

subject: Defer to element mysql.innodb_buffer_pool_size
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-08 15:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud-source.yaml', 'overcloud-source.yaml'], 'message': "Defer to element mysql.innodb_buffer_pool_size

Choosing 100MB here is not a production default. We also don't need two
places with the default value set. The closer a default is to the actual
usage of it, the better, so we'll set 0 here, which will defer to the
default in the element.

Change-Id: I1b41b604286245c2fb83249778db835253c02fc5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Defer to element mysql.innodb_buffer_pool_size

Choosing 100MB here is not a production default. We also don't need two
places with the default value set. The closer a default is to the actual
usage of it, the better, so we'll set 0 here, which will defer to the
default in the element.

Change-Id: I1b41b604286245c2fb83249778db835253c02fc5

subject: Fix KeyError if neutron security group is not TCP/UDP/ICMP and no ports
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-30 02:42:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix KeyError if neutron security group is not TCP/UDP/ICMP and no ports

Previously, if a neutron security group rule was created that was not
TCP/UDP/ICMP and did not contain a port_range_min/max retrieving it from
nova-api would result in a KeyError in nova-api. This patch resolves
this issue.

Change-Id: I6284a7a8690aec9509b63f7cbd18812e09ef3fdd
Closes-bug: #1294346
(cherry picked from commit 3ad414597043979b8d73c17c05e666cff33a9b88)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError if neutron security group is not TCP/UDP/ICMP and no ports

Previously, if a neutron security group rule was created that was not
TCP/UDP/ICMP and did not contain a port_range_min/max retrieving it from
nova-api would result in a KeyError in nova-api. This patch resolves
this issue.

Change-Id: I6284a7a8690aec9509b63f7cbd18812e09ef3fdd
Closes-bug: #1294346
(cherry picked from commit 3ad414597043979b8d73c17c05e666cff33a9b88)

commit_message:
Ambiguous option error should not appear if Arg is SUPPRESS

Due to backward compatibility there are arguments hidden.
For example:

--tenant-id and --tenant_id

On those case the abbreviation mechanism if a user enter
--tenant throw that there is an ambiguity but the helps only
show --tenant-id as an optional argument.
This change remove this ambiguity if one of them is hidden.

Change-Id: I413f1ebafc68b3e02b5abadce1608e6d48207b01
Closes-Bug: #1252457

commit_message:
Remove outdated blurb about more mem for 64bit vms

The comment for using more memory for 64bit vm's makes no sense given
that the exampe we provide uses the same memory as our 32bit example.
Removing this comment.

Change-Id: I6ea79e3f0f04c33f10b138b9fa66e65009ee8938

commit_message:
Remove explicit dependency on amqplib

kombu already depends on amqp or amqplib depending on its
version, and no explicit access to amqplib exists in nova code.

Update logging config to list both amqp and amqplib, as kombu
will setup one or the other.

Change-Id: I716050593cde15f2a614175d9849340e5858fc32

commit_message:
Check documentation for simple style requirements

What is checked:
 - lines should not be longer than 79 characters, also
   there are few exceptions;
 - no tabulation for indentation;
 - no trailing whitespace.

Change-Id: Id5b5dff380460d1fb4ffeeb23f00864e7fc158ed

commit_message:
Drop service* tables only if they exist

Tables servicedefinitions and servicetypes are not used by neutron but
created using db migration tool. If quantum-server in grizzly was
started without using migration tool then tables mentioned above are not
created. During migration from grizzly to havana alembic attempts to
drop these unused tables. This patch uses "IF EXISTS" clause when
dropping mentioned tables.

Closes-bug: #1273355
Change-Id: I33fcb3e1dc96ce37ec9c00987cb5a3a953ca691d

commit_message:
Add Ceilometer to control node by default

Make Ceilometer part of the overcloud control node
deployment and add password args to support populating
ceilometer.conf

Change-Id: I275402fa914c11cccb7b131a5eac2d663c4cf9ff

[{'created': '2014-05-01 19:32:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Stop periodic watcher tasks before deleting stack

In the case where a stack that has a watch task associated with it is

commit_message:
Stop periodic watcher tasks before deleting stack

In the case where a stack that has a watch task associated with it is
being deleted and the engine successfully acquires a lock, no attempt to
stop the stack will be made since it has no action in-progress.  This
will result in orphaned watcher tasks being left behind, since the
watcher tasks are normally stopped as part of the call to
ThreadGroup.stop().

To fix this, explicitly stop the periodic watcher tasks before calling
stack.delete().

Change-Id: Idf5b7c1100fc85743ac6dc5831731f7ecc96bfd6
Closes-Bug: #1315044

commit_message:
Remove duplicate module-rgx line in .pylintrc

The correct neutron configuration will no longer be overwritten by
the old quantum configuration.

Change-Id: I4923ad4e35a5053966edb307587c72c0b684d149
Closes-Bug: 1316334

commit_message:
Reference new get_engine() method from wsgi.py

wsgi.py referenced get_engine in neutron.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.session.
This method was removed from that file in commit 53609f29f3c8fcadc545afb891189253c07b33c3
change-id I0e1d86878d3eb924b01e04dced0f90b4e57757d8. This patch references the
replacement method added to neutron.db.api.

Closes-Bug: #1314850
Change-Id: Ifd4db5f49e2aaebc67eccb8bdcef8eea54983112

commit_message:
Testcase to get default quota with invalid tenantid

Added a test case test_get_default_quotas_for_invalid_tenant to
test_quotas_negative.py script in api/compute/v3/admin/ folder.
The test case is skipped current s there is a bug for this scenario.
bug id is #1307393. The test case expects NotFound exception when we
get default quotas with invalid tenant id.

Change-Id: I97020212cbdd7bb31a53e8469af227a7347fdc41

commit_message:
Refactoring test on test_api

Addition of function get_response_object_data() to remove the repeating
lines in many methods.The code had some spaces which got automatically
added.The spaces have been removed

recheck bug 1307344

This bug is an action item to track the review comment for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/64079/4 raised by Steve Kowalik.

commit_message:
lbaas on a network without gateway

Not only check the gateway_ip in subnet, but also
check the host_routes. If there is a default route in host_routes
then the next hop of the default route is also a gateway_ip.

Closes-Bug: 1300017
DocImpact

Change-Id: Id3ae04bfa6cefb1c030857894f0594828b8e856d

download.  The settings are documented here:

from the default settings.  It also allows unbalanced download/upload which
is preferred in openstack environments.

commit_message:
XenAPI: adjust bittorrent settings

This commit addresses some optimizations when using libtorrent to
download.  The settings are documented here:
http://www.rasterbar.com/products/libtorrent/reference-Settings.html

I'm proposing to add these with dom0 environment overrides in case
any other adjustments are needed.  The changes effectively double the
download rate from the default settings.  It also allows unbalanced
download/upload which is preferred in openstack environments.

No unit tests were added as plugins are not currently unit tested.

Closes-bug: #1303993

Change-Id: I503a6a521c196e4ad58e0a16aba2988f66a9cdca

commit_message:
Replace unicode() for six.text_type

To support Python3, unicode() calls has been replaced by
six.text_type.
Added utils.exception_to_str(): is the proper way to convert
an exception to string, since it manages logic related to
encoding.

Change-Id: I27101390e4f95e5c7690b1b445b7e75b8bcb9a08
Closes-Bug: #1284677

commit_message:
Adding collectl element.

Collectl can be useful for 'benchmarking, monitoring a system's general
health or trying to determine what your system was doing at some time in
the past.'

Change-Id: Ic629c73f9d42227636f1a3df2ee82b8fe5bc788c

commit_message:
Fix H302 violations

H302 violation is reported by flake8 when importing separated objects from
modules instead of importing the whole module.
e.g.   from package.module import function
       function()
is changed to
       from package import module
       module.function()

Change-Id: Ifbf31b52316d3cade40743752a49ce700f384a21
Closes-Bug: #1291032

commit_message:
Set max avaliable TTL for Mcollective

We use virtual machine snapshots for CI. When we
up it from snapshots, we get error:
"MCollective agents '<ID>' didn't respond within
the allotted time.", but node is online. Big TTL
in Mcollective should solve this problem.

Change-Id: Id3f2f5ddf26a9d31de214e9d5596a47f450b983f
Closes-Bug: #1316720

commit_message:
RPC_API_VERSION out of sync

This sets the RPC_API_VERSION for the conductor manager to be 1.15,
which is the same as the version on the API/client side.

A unit test was added to check that the RPC_API_VERSIONs are equal.

Comments in rpcapi.py and manager.py were added to remind readers
that the versions need to be in sync.

Change-Id: I047603d2d1117399978e98b9a93c9c32f512bbf1
Closes-Bug: #1317202

commit_message:
Allow adding passwords in setup-*-passwords

By default we don't overwrite password files when running devtest,
which means that when a new password is needed the existing
password files must be deleted and regenerated or the new password
will not exist.  This change checks for the existence of each
password individually so that new passwords can simply be appended
to the password files.

Closes-Bug: #1314615

Change-Id: I746749c6cc07e7b43bd3bc327b62098d72e317cf

commit_message:
Start ping listener also for postgresql

Make use of the automatic connection disposal for
PostgreSQL as well.

oslo-incubator commit: 4a591eaafe035fa3fd508c910f057bfa8ff51005

[{'created': '2014-04-25 07:42:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Database exception causes UnboundLocalError in linuxbridge-agent

When database exception raises from update_device_down,
the linuxbridge-agent doesn't deal with them in a proper way
that causes accessing not-existed local variables.

A straightforward workaround is to jump to the next loop when
some unexpected error happens to the current device.

Change-Id: I32a9467876a619a7d0ad53ff3d5d95ff977e54f4
Closes-Bug: #1311971
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-04-25 08:14:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Database exception causes UnboundLocalError in linuxbridge-agent

When database exception raises from update_device_down,
the linuxbridge-agent doesn't deal with them in a proper way
that causes accessing not-existed local variables.

commit_message:
Database exception causes UnboundLocalError in linuxbridge-agent

When database exception raises from update_device_down,
the linuxbridge-agent doesn't deal with them in a proper way
that causes accessing not-existed local variables.

A straightforward workaround is to set it as None by default
and verify its value then.

Change-Id: I32a9467876a619a7d0ad53ff3d5d95ff977e54f4
Closes-Bug: #1311971

commit_message:
Install murano-apps before import its content

Forgot to install package murano-apps, now fix it.
Add category when importing packages.
Option '-c' must be specified after the target directory name.
Typos fixes.
Add workaround to call import-package only once per package.

Relates-bug: 1316069

Change-Id: I49cc86e60b446355093a85747256113b5f6a8d16

OpenStack infra without specialness.

commit_message:
Update links in README

* github to git.openstack.org
* ML openstack to openstack-dev as that is where development discussions
  happen
* nova.openstack.org to docs.openstack.org/developer/nova as that is
  the nova.openstack.org just redirects to there

commit_message:
Remove explicit dependency on amqplib

kombu already depends on amqp or amqplib depending on its
version, and no explicit access to amqplib exists in neutron code.

Closes-Bug: #1317094
Change-Id: I5cf189d7173b732cba6df3f9b6aff1d2bb85cdfe

commit_message:
Give resource fakes a string ID

Resource ID values are actually UUIDs but unit tests assume
they are typed as integers.

This change uses the same numbers for test IDs but types them
as strings, which makes the resource fakes closer to real-world
usage.

Change-Id: I8c9d6889db6451019e3986729906b5a37188c133

commit_message:
Eager-load Stack.raw_template for Stack.load

Whenever a stack is loaded from the database to perform a
parser.Stack.load, the raw_template should be prefetched to
avoid an extra sql query being performed.

However there are many calls to db_api.stack_get which do not need
to access Stack.raw_template, so the default behaviour is to
lazy-load it.

This change reduces the queries for a Stack.load from 3 to 2, so it
contributes to Related-Bug: #1306743

Change-Id: Ie6dad6ea4b1655a99e97a9ac2b7c00018406cd91

commit_message:
Fetch RawTemplate from Stack, not a query

This will allow a future optimisation to prefetch Stack.raw_template
in a single query.

[{'created': '2014-04-24 05:19:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fetch all db resources in one query

Instead of calling resource_get_by_name_and_stack once for every
resource in the stack, db_api.resource_get_all_by_stack is called
only once for all resources.

This reduces the number of sql queries during a describe_stack_resource
call to 3:
1. load the stack
2. load the template
3. load the resources

This is a big improvement over the start of this patch series, which
is 2 queries plus:
* 1 per resource in the stack
* 1 per access to a resource metadata attribute
* 1 per access to a resource data value

There is probably still potential to reduce queries from 3, but this
may well be a fix for
Partial-Bug: 1306743

commit_message:
Fetch all db resources in one query

Instead of calling resource_get_by_name_and_stack once for every
resource in the stack, db_api.resource_get_all_by_stack is called
only once for all resources.

This reduces the number of sql queries during a describe_stack_resource
call to 3:
1. load the stack
2. load the template
3. load the resources

This is a big improvement over the start of this patch series, which
is 2 queries plus:
* 1 per resource in the stack
* 1 per access to a resource metadata attribute
* 1 per access to a resource data value

There is probably still potential to reduce queries from 3, but this
may well be a fix for
Partial-Bug: 1306743

Change-Id: I80be5d3de8744813d974f2e9860c148ad258f385

commit_message:
Ensure objects are passed over RPC

This adds a serializer for designate objects.  Now designate objects
are serialized and deserialized over RPC.

Change-Id: I525eb51871221978641cdbf70e3b15a8c55d99a9

if something goes wrong in the pretty tox tests, we actually get
entirely unhelpful 1 != 0 errors, that provide no ability to

commit_message:
refactor out code duplication

pull out the duplication of setup that was in all the test
functions and put it in setup instead.

capture stdout/stderr on pretty tox tests

if something goes wrong in the pretty tox tests, we actually get
entirely unhelpful 1 != 0 errors, that provide no ability to
debug. A big part of this is because stdout and stderr were not
captured.

Capture and replay stdout / stderr in case of fails to be able to
debug.

Change-Id: I7c21e47805a765d9e3c8f367dfa153d54ff10414
